## Risk Premium and Sharpe Ratio Calculation ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(505) #| eval: true #| echo: false #| results: asis #| warning: false library(webexercises) rf <- rnorm(1, mean = 2, sd = 0.2) re <- rnorm(1, mean = 8, sd = 1) sigma <- rnorm(1, mean = 15, sd = 2) risk_premium <- re - rf sharpe_ratio <- risk_premium / sigma ``` ::: An investment has an expected return of **6.72%**, a risk‑free rate of **1.78%**, and a volatility (standard deviation) of **10.92%**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ Risk premium = expected return − risk‑free rate = **4.94**%.
::: ::: {.question-block}
✅ Sharpe ratio = risk premium / volatility = **0.45**.
:::
